metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4734 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
WebKit in Apple iOS before 10, Safari before 10, and tvOS before 10 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(memory corruption) via a crafted web site, a different vulnerability thanCVE-2016-4611, CVE-2016-4730, CVE-2016-4733, and CVE-2016-4735.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
